bow: why am so afraid to have second child my first just turned years old great kid since birth pretty uneventful pregnancy and delivery so and are generally happy functional and have no financial issues why am so afraid to do it again we ve always said we have kids and want my daughter to have sibling 33 and don want to wait much longer but finally feeling like myself again after child both physically and mentally emotionally and we have good family rhythm right now im afraid of the chaos suppose and feeling selfish about giving my body up again sounds terrible know guess just looking for some input and or experiences about having and how it impacted your life family totally get it have 4yo twins and even though we ve always talked about having kids we are definitely considering the idea that we may be done my wife carried our twins after went through year of unsuccessful fertility treatments but she has mysterious genetic issue that caused us to lose our first son at 20 weeks and led to high risk pregnancy with the twins we re not comfortable with her even trying to carry again so up to bat again if we decide to try while have carried pregnancy to term myself the fertility treatments are invasive and exhausting so understand how you feel like you do want to give up your body again we ve also talked about how we re actually able to take them out in public without them acting like insane wild animals now and the idea of starting over with newborn is daunting right now we re just playing it by ear we re enjoying our dynamic as family of for now and we ll trust our guts if it feels right to try again down the road do put too much pressure on yourself you still have plenty of time just enjoy your family and your return to feeling like yourself until trying again feels right currently pregnant with my second tried hard to get pregnant again two losses before this one seems to be sticking so in sum wanted another baby but this time half excited and half filled with dread because now you know what pregnancy birth and for me the first six months likely entails and some of it is wonderful and beautiful and lot of it is painful and hard do feel like one kid still allows you some personal space and with two kids really signing myself up for family life wanting some personal space is normal and healthy there nothing wrong with having one kid if that the route you choose wish had advice for you but feel the exact same way with my first before got pregnant all could think about was having baby was so excited thrilled impatient for it it was all thought about talked about dreamed about now my son is and even though my so and have both said we wanted another still waiting for that urge to hit me and it just not coming feel no excitement at the thought of being pregnant again even though my first pregnancy was easy are we supposed to wait until we feel that undeniable craving for baby again what if it never comes or are we supposed to just push through and get pregnant again and hope the excitement comes later just for the sake of giving our first child sibling scared of waiting too long and regretting it because their age gap is too big also scared of having second one before mentally and emotionally prepared for it and regretting giving up my freedom when wasn ready to which is worse for my son not having sibling at all or having sibling but also having mom who is exhausted regretful because she had second baby before she was ready again sorry can help you just wanted you to know you re not alone no advice really just solidarity also 33 and my son is months my labor was traumatic and am also feeling no desires to carry pregnancy again life is starting to stabilize finally and love my son so friggin much but desperately miss alone time life is just so busy with one thought have but now really doubting it feels like selfish choice but the more talk to single children ask bunch of questions to any come across haha the more convinced am the stopping at one would be better for him too removed removed didn feel like had my head above water with my first till he turned two at age two the thought of having second child seemed survivable at two and half the thought of having second child seemed doable we re just about to start trying because suspect that by age three the thought of having second child will be enjoyable we re aiming for year spread between the two kiddos and human gestation math means that we have to start this thing asap if we re going to hit our target my son is and 13 weeks currently one of my biggest motivating factors was so that he could have someone to play with don think was ever ready but we didn use protection didn think was in my fertile window and here we are it going to be challenge for sure but we are still in baby mode so eager to add this one to the mix so we can settle on new normal loss of personal time self was huge issue for my husband more in he didn know how to manage his time well priorities it been learning curve for both of us and we are going in to adding second with the idea that we just have to find our new normal took us while with our son and sure it going to take some time again and if personal time is huge thing for you both then make sure each gets that don mind doing kid duty solo for night or two week if get the same in return travels ton and always comes back and get break it not that don enjoy my son toddlers are just exhausting lol and honestly this pregnancy has already thrown us for curve ball medically that we are already adjusting to the needs for another baby oh and sleep was such limited thing in those early days but we have plan in place now and we know what to expect as long as on leave and breastfeeding ll handle the wake ups feedings while he can get rest for his job and to parent our toddler it what going to work best for us there is zero reason for both of us to get less sleep if we can help it and know the minute say need him to take over for few nights he will without hesitation really just scared of labor again it was pretty traumatic for both my husband and and we aren really looking forward to that part hoping big bro helped paved the way down there was little scared to have second child had section with my first and knew that likely have to have one again was also scared about pregnancy while having toddler was hard additionally going from one to two was incredibly hard having two people need something very different from you at once is somehow more than twice as hard as only one person needing something from you don get me wrong would make the choice again in heartbeat also in few years do want another what saying is it hard and if you don want to do it don if you do want to you ll love those children so much it will be worth it don feel it is selfish to want your body back to yourself this is your life too thanks for posting this—my son is 14 months and feel the same way we want two always imagined two but the thought of newborn sounds just exhausting for all of us posting comments it so important to remember the broad sociological zoomed out view—we live in moment where the nuclear family doesn get much support when women work the second shift and do far more than their share of child care and housework not to mention elder care—the statistics of gender division are devastating there as well so of course the birth rate is going down in some demographics white middle class women and can we all have collective thank you moment to the fact that we have
